org.sd.classifier
Class BaseFeatureAttribute

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.classifier.BaseFeatureAttribute
All Implemented Interfaces:
FeatureAttribute
Direct Known Subclasses:
NominalFeatureAttribute, NumericFeatureAttribute
public abstract class BaseFeatureAttribute
extends java.lang.Object
implements FeatureAttribute

Abstract base implementation of the FeatureAttribute interface.

Author:
Spence Koehler, Dave Barney

getDefaultValue

public java.lang.Double getDefaultValue()
Get a default value for this attribute if it is an attribute whose value is always present, even when not marked as such. If there is no default value then the "unknown" value (null here or a question mark in an arff) will be emitted.

A default value exists for features whose value is always known, but hasn't been explicitly set.

For example, bag of words features are either present or not. If not present, they haven't been seen, but it is known that they are not present as opposed to not knowing whether they are present.

Specified by:
getDefaultValue in interface FeatureAttribute
Returns:
the default value or null if the attribute can be unknown.

setDefaultValue

public java.lang.Double setDefaultValue(java.lang.Double defaultValue)
Set a default value for this attribute.

A default value of null means this attribute can be unknown; otherwise, when not seen, its value will be assumed to be the default value.

Returns:
the previously set default value.
